citation.article-title: Nocardioides ultimimeridianus sp. nov. and Nocardioides maradonensis sp. nov., isolated from rhizosphere soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardioides maradonensis sp. nov.
Nocardioides maradonensis (ma.ra.do.nen′sis. N.L. masc. adj. maradonensis of or belonging to Mara-do, Jeju, Republic of Korea).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-reaction-positive, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive, non-motile short rods (0.6–1.1×1.1–1.5 µm).
Colonies are light yellow in colour, circular, convex, sticky with entire margins and reach 0.1–0.2 mm in diameter after incubation for 5 days (on ISP 2 medium at 30 °C).
Growth does not occur on TSA or NA.
Growth occurs at 20–37 °C (optimum 30–37 °C), at pH 5–10 and in 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Does not hydrolyse casein, cellulose or DNA.
Degrades hypoxanthine but not dl-tyrosine or xanthine.
Positive for esterase lipase (C8), esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase and α-glucosidase.
Utilizes cellobiose, citrate, dextran, d-fructose, d-galactose, gluconate, d-glucose, dl-malate, melezitose, raffinose, d-sorbitol, succinate and sucrose as sole carbon and energy sources.
Does not utilize adonitol, d-arabinose, benzoate, dulcitol, meso-erythritol, formate, glycerol, lactose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, l-sorbose, trehalose, d-xylitol or d-xylose.
Data for other physiological and biochemical properties are given in Table 1.
ll-DAP is the diagnostic diamino acid.
The polar lipids include phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylglycerol.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω9c and C16 : 1 2-OH.
The type strain, RP-B30T ( = KCTC 19384T = DSM 19769T), was isolated from rhizosphere soil of a cliff-associated plant (Peucedanum japonicum Thunb.) on Mara Island, Jeju, Republic of Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 71.7 mol%.
